Code documentation

In general the code is split into three main operations: * Processing user inputs * Calculations of eigenfrequencies * Visualisation

Modules and classes involved in each of these can be found on seperate pages.

class NM_image.NM_image

Abstract base class. Sub-classes of this are classes to generate different types of plots E.g. a class called gen_dispersion

abstract init_anim_data()

Initialises/creates matplotlib artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations see - _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

make()

Function is the driver for plotting - accessed by main codes. This incorporates any loading of the data and processing (e.g. integration). Then runs the make_plot function to actually make the plot

abstract update_anim_data(iteration)

Function is used to update MPL artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations for given iteration value see _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

Parameters

iteration (int) – Iteration step for animations

class radial_2D_plot.radial_2D_plot(ps_axis)

A concrete subclass of NM_image that produces displacement vs depth 2D plots for an individual mode.

init_anim_data()

Initialises data values for first frame of an animation.

update_anim_data(iteration)

Function is used to update MPL artists (e.g. a 2DLine object) as part of animations for given iteration value see _gen_animations() in ps_figure.py

Parameters

iteration (int) – Iteration step for animations

class disp_curve.disp_curve(ps_axis)

A concrete subclass of NM_image that produces dispersion plots for multiple n, l, omega combinations.

init_anim_data()

Function defined in ABC but not used for this type of plot.

update_anim_data(iteration)

Function defined in ABC but not used for this type of plot.

class ps_axis.ps_axis(type, data_fname, int_required, N, L, radius, axis_loc=111)

ps_axis objects are created from the users input and pass information/specifications to the plotting scripts for a single matplotlib axis as part of a figure. Data these objects hold include the type of plot, the normal mode(s) that are to be plotted and any relevant model data, and the location of the axis on the figure.

class ps_figure.ps_figure(axes_list, fname_out)

ps_figure objects hold a matplotlib figure and data required to populate it with a number of axes.

plot()

Create the different NM_image subclass objects (e.g. dispersion, 2D_radial) from the inputted PS_axis objs This also adds the plots from each of these subclasses to the overall figure
